item.title: 安费诺将以 105 亿美元收购 CommScope 的宽带连接和电缆部门
item.description: 光纤电缆制造商安费诺公司周一表示，将以 105 亿美元的全现金交易收购 CommScope 的连接和电缆解决方案业务。【原文：Fiber-optic cable maker Amphenol said on Monday it will buy CommScope's connectivity and cable solutions business for $10.5 billion in an all-cash deal.】

item.title: 实验室设备需求旺盛，沃特世上调 2025 年利润预期下限
item.description: 实验室设备制造商沃特斯周一上调了全年利润预期的下限，此前该公司公布的第二季度业绩好于预期，原因是生物技术客户对其用于药物开发和研究的工具的需求增加。【原文：Lab equipment maker Waters raised the lower end of its annual profit forecast on Monday after reporting better-than-expected second-quarter results on improved demand from biotech clients for its tools used in drug development and research.】

item.title: 哈雷戴维森任命 Topgolf 的 Arthur Starrs 为新任首席执行官
item.description: 哈雷戴维森（Harley-Davidson）周一任命亚瑟-斯塔斯（Arthur Starrs）为下一任首席执行官，自 10 月 1 日起生效，结束了为接替现任首席执行官约亨-蔡茨（Jochen Zeitz）而进行的长期物色。【原文：Harley-Davidson on Monday named Arthur Starrs as its next CEO, effective October 1, ending a prolonged search for a candidate to succeed incumbent Jochen Zeitz.】

item.title: 凯雷为押注美国房地产融资 90 亿美元
item.description: 凯雷投资集团周一告诉路透社，该集团已为其最新的美国房地产基金募集到 90 亿美元资金，在部分行业出现初步复苏迹象的情况下，该集团将创纪录地募集资金投入到土地和建筑领域。【原文：Carlyle has raised $9 billion for its latest U.S. real estate fund, the investment group told Reuters on Monday, giving it a record fundraising haul to deploy into land and buildings amid tentative signs of recovery in parts of the sector.】

item.title: 电动空中出租车公司 Joby 将收购 Blade Air 的客运业务
item.description: 乔比航空（Joby Aviation）周一表示，该公司将以不超过 1.25 亿美元的价格收购直升机共享公司 Blade Air Mobility 的客运业务，以加快部署用于商业客运服务的电动空中出租车。【原文：Joby Aviation will acquire helicopter rideshare company Blade Air Mobility's passenger business for up to $125 million, it said Monday, as it works to speed the deployment of electric air taxis for commercial passenger services.】

item.title: 委内瑞拉 7 月石油出口下降，原因是合作伙伴在等待美国授权
item.description: 根据船只跟踪数据和公司文件显示，由于委内瑞拉国家石油公司（PDVSA）的主要合作伙伴正在等待美国授权扩大在该国的业务，委内瑞拉 7 月份的石油出口量比上月下降了约 10%。【原文：Venezuela's oil exports declined about 10% in July from the previous month as key partners of state company PDVSA awaited U.S. authorizations to expand operations in the country, according to vessel tracking data and company documents.】

item.title: 早间竞标薪资疲软，信使被解雇
item.description: 当今美国和全球市场的重要事件【原文：What matters in U.S. and global markets today】

item.title: 由于 COVID 疫苗销量增加，BioNTech 第二季度收入翻番
item.description: 德国生物技术公司 BioNTech 周一表示，由于与辉瑞公司合作的 COVID-19 疫苗收入增加，第二季度收入翻了一番多，达到 2.61 亿欧元（3.02 亿美元）。【原文：German biotech firm BioNTech on Monday said that second-quarter revenues more than doubled to 261 million euros ($302 million), driven by higher revenues from its COVID-19 vaccine collaboration with Pfizer .】

item.title: 聚焦：Evercore 交易加速人才冲刺，银行预期并购回暖
item.description: 欧洲是全球第二大并购费用来源地，精品交易顾问公司 Evercore 通过上周的一次收购，在交易活动可能回暖之前锁定了人才，加快了其在欧洲成为一支重要力量的步伐。【原文：Boutique deal-making adviser Evercore accelerated its campaign to become a significant force in Europe, the world's second largest pool of M&A fees, with a purchase last week that locks in talent ahead of a possible upturn in activity.】

item.title: 特斯拉批准向首席执行官埃隆-马斯克颁发价值 290 亿美元的股份奖励
item.description: 特斯拉公司已授予首席执行官埃隆-马斯克价值约 290 亿美元的 9600 万股股票，此举旨在让这位亿万富翁企业家继续掌舵特斯拉，因为他正在与法院的一项裁决作斗争。【原文：Tesla has granted CEO Elon Musk 96 million shares worth about $29 billion, a move aimed at keeping the billionaire entrepreneur at the helm as he fights a court ruling that voided his original pay deal for being unfair to shareholders.】

item.title: 华尔街期货在重挫后企稳
item.description: 华尔街期货周一上涨，在经历了一个动荡的交易日后趋于稳定，因为投资者在上周公布了一份出人意料的疲软就业报告后，对美联储将进一步降息的预期有所升温。【原文：Wall Street futures rose on Monday, stabilizing after a turbulent session as investors priced in deeper interest rate cuts by the Federal Reserve following a surprisingly soft jobs report last week.】

item.title: 贸易谈判代表称台湾关税谈判必须保密
item.description: 台湾副首席贸易谈判代表颜惠馨周一表示，台湾与美国的贸易谈判仍在进行中，一旦敲定将提交国会审查，在此期间必须保密。【原文：Taiwan's trade negotiations with the United States are still underway and will be submitted to parliament for review once finalized, and must remain confidential in the meantime, deputy chief trade negotiator Yen Hui-hsin said on Monday.】

item.title: 独家报道马斯克支持特朗普后，特斯拉的品牌忠诚度崩溃了
item.description: 根据研究公司 S&P Global Mobility 与路透社独家分享的数据，特斯拉多年来在美国的回头客比其他任何主要汽车品牌都多，但自从首席执行官埃隆-马斯克去年夏天支持唐纳德-特朗普总统以来，特斯拉的忠诚度急剧下降。【原文：Tesla for years had more repeat U.S. customers than any other major automotive brand but its loyalty has plunged since CEO Elon Musk endorsed President Donald Trump last summer, according to data from research firm S&P Global Mobility shared exclusively with Reuters.】

item.title: Spotify 将从 9 月起提高部分市场的高级订阅价格
item.description: Spotify 周一表示，将从 9 月起提高部分市场的高级个人订阅月费，因为这家瑞典流媒体巨头希望提高利润率。【原文：Spotify said on Monday it would increase the monthly price of its premium individual subscription in select markets from September, as the Swedish streaming giant looks to improve margins.】

item.title: 缓冲 "ETF 市场的膨胀导致产品种类更加复杂
item.description: 在过去两年里，提供这种概念变体的交易所交易基金的数量和规模都翻了一番。【原文：Investors are piling into financial products that offer them the chance to forgo some potential gains in exchange for protection against a market selloff, with the number of exchange-traded funds offering variants on this concept doubling in number and size over the last two years.】

item.title: 解说：围绕特朗普关税的美国法庭之争接下来会发生什么？
item.description: 周四，一个联邦上诉小组似乎对美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的论点表示怀疑，即历史上用于制裁敌人或冻结其资产的 1977 年法律赋予了他征收关税的权力。【原文：A federal appeals panel on Thursday appeared skeptical of U.S. President Donald Trump's argument that a 1977 law historically used for sanctioning enemies or freezing their assets gave him the power to impose tariffs.】

item.title: 特斯拉 7 月中国产电动汽车销量下降 8.4
item.description: 面对竞争对手不断推出低价新车型的竞争，特斯拉 7 月份在中国生产的电动汽车销量同比下降了 8.4%，扭转了 6 月份的温和增长势头。【原文：Tesla's sales of China-made electric vehicles in July fell 8.4% from a year earlier, reversing a mild increase in June, in the face of rising competition from rivals offering lower-priced new models.】

item.title: 印度 Bharti Airtel 为电信运营商推出云服务
item.description: 印度第二大电信公司 Bharti Airtel 周一表示，其数字部门 Xtelify 推出了一个云平台，可为印度企业优化高达 40% 的云支出。印度第二大电信公司 Bharti Airtel 周一表示，其数字部门 Xtelify 推出了一个云平台，可为印度企业优化高达 40% 的云支出。【原文：Bharti Airtel , India's no. 2 telco, said on Monday its digital arm Xtelify launched a cloud platform which can optimise up to 40% in cloud spends for Indian businesses.】

item.title: 韩美准备峰会，贸易协议细节仍未解决
item.description: 专家表示，唐纳德-特朗普总统可能会利用与李在明总统的峰会寻求在国防成本和企业投资方面做出更多让步。【原文：President Donald Trump may use the summit with counterpart Lee Jae Myung to seek more concessions on defence costs and corporate investments, experts said.】

item.title: 富士康以 8800 万美元出售 Lordstown 工厂，并将继续占用厂房
item.description: 富士康周一表示，已达成以 8800 万美元出售俄亥俄州 Lordstown 前工厂的协议，并称计划将所得资金重新投资于美国，并将继续使用该工厂。【原文：Foxconn said on Monday it had struck a deal to sell the former Lordstown factory in Ohio for $88 million, saying it planned to reinvest the proceeds in the United States and would continue to occupy the facility.】

item.title: 瑞士奢侈钟表制造商在特朗普关税冲击后下跌
item.description: 包括历峰集团（Richemont）和斯沃琪集团（Swatch）在内的瑞士奢侈钟表制造商的股票在周一早盘交易中波动剧烈，凸显了美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）对瑞士进口商品征收39%关税之后该行业所面临的挑战。【原文：Swiss luxury watchmakers' shares, including Richemont and Swatch , were volatile in early trade on Monday, underscoring the challenges for the industry after U.S. President Donald Trump imposed a 39% tariff on Swiss imports.】

item.title: 斯沃琪首席执行官呼吁瑞士总统与特朗普会面以解决关税争端
item.description: 斯沃琪集团首席执行官尼克-海耶克（Nick Hayek）呼吁瑞士总统卡琳-凯勒-萨特（Karin Keller-Sutter）在华盛顿与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）会面，就瑞士对美国进口产品征收 39% 的关税一事进行谈判，以达成更好的协议。【原文：Swatch Group Chief Executive Nick Hayek called on Swiss President Karin Keller-Sutter to meet U.S. President Donald Trump in Washington to negotiate a better deal than the 39% tariffs announced on Swiss imports into the United States.】

item.title: 日本双日株式会社、JOGMEC 与美国铝业公司合作在澳大利亚开展镓研究
item.description: 日本贸易公司双日（Sojitz）周一表示，双日与日本金属和能源安全组织（JOGMEC）成立了一家合资企业，研究澳大利亚的镓生产。【原文：Japanese trading house Sojitz established a joint venture with Japan Organization for Metals and Energy Security (JOGMEC) to study gallium production in Australia, Sojitz said on Monday.】

item.title: 意大利竞争管理机构对中国申银万国罚款 100 万欧元
item.description: 意大利竞争管理机构（AGCM）周一宣布对中国快速时尚在线零售商Shein处以100万欧元（116万美元）的罚款，原因是其在产品对环境的影响方面误导顾客。【原文：Italy's competition authority (AGCM) on Monday announced a 1-million-euro ($1.16 million) fine on Chinese fast fashion online retailer Shein for misleading customers on the environmental impact of its products.】

item.title: 作为贸易协议的一部分，马来西亚同意加强从美国采购技术和液化天然气
item.description: 马来西亚贸易部长周一表示，作为与华盛顿达成的削减关税协议的一部分，马来西亚将在未来五年斥资高达1500亿美元从美国跨国公司购买设备，用于半导体、航空航天和数据中心行业。【原文：Malaysia will spend up to $150 billion in the next five years to buy equipment from U.S. multinationals for its semiconductor, aerospace and data centre sectors, part of a deal with Washington to cut tariffs, its trade minister said on Monday.】

item.title: 英国石油公司在巴西近海发现数十年来最大的石油储量
item.description: 英国石油公司（BP）周一表示，该公司在巴西桑托斯盆地发现了 25 年来最大规模的石油和天然气，该盆地是所谓的前盐区，位于近海深水区，据信蕴藏着大量石油和天然气。【原文：BP said on Monday it has made its largest oil and gas discovery in 25 years in Brazil's Santos basin, a so-called pre-salt area in deep water offshore which is believed to be a large reservoir of oil and gas.】

item.title: 德国财长将在华盛顿之行中推动钢铁配额制
item.description: 德国财政部长拉尔斯-克林拜尔（Lars Klingbeil）在周一晚些时候与美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）的会晤中告诉一家广播公司，他将主张在欧盟与美国的贸易协议中加入钢铁出口配额制度。【原文：German Finance Minister Lars Klingbeil will advocate for a quota system on steel exports to be included in the EU's trade deal with the United States at a meeting with his U.S. counterpart, Scott Bessent, later on Monday, he told a radio broadcaster.】

item.title: 日本首相石破茂表示将与特朗普会谈以尽早削减美国汽车关税
item.description: 日本首相石破茂周一表示，他将毫不犹豫地与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普举行会谈，以确保美国汽车关税削减协议尽快得到落实。【原文：Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba said on Monday he will not hesitate to hold talks with President Donald Trump to ensure an agreed cut to U.S. automobile tariffs is implemented soon.】

item.title: 瑞银支付 3 亿美元解决美国抵押贷款证券案件
item.description: 瑞银集团周一表示，将支付 3 亿美元，以了结与瑞士信贷在美国误售抵押贷款挂钩投资相关的未偿债务。【原文：UBS on Monday said it will pay $300 million to settle outstanding obligations related to the misselling of mortgage-linked investments by Credit Suisse in the United States.】

item.title: 超过 3,000 名波音战斗机工人拒绝合同提议后举行罢工
item.description: 在圣路易斯地区和伊利诺伊州组装波音战斗机的3200多名工会成员在前一天拒绝了第二次合同提议后，于周一举行了罢工。【原文：More than 3,200 union members who assemble Boeing's fighter jets in the St. Louis area and Illinois went on strike on Monday after rejecting a second contract offer the previous day.】
